section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Anaphylaxis" means a sudden, severe, and potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that occurs when an individual is exposed to an allergen.
"Auto-injectable epinephrine" means a portable, disposable drug delivery device that contains a premeasured single dose of epinephrine that is used to treat anaphylaxis in an emergency situation.

text.section:
Each county board shall establish a policy for public schools within its jurisdiction to authorize the school nurse and other school personnel to administer auto-injectable epinephrine, if available, to a student who is determined to be or perceived to be in anaphylaxis, regardless of whether the student:
Has been identified as having an anaphylactic allergy, as defined in § 7-426.1 of this subtitle; or
Has a prescription for epinephrine as prescribed by an authorized licensed health care practitioner under the Health Occupations Article.

section.section: Each public school shall submit, on the form that the Department requires, a report to the Department on each incident at the school or at a related school event that required the use of auto-injectable epinephrine.
The Department shall develop and disseminate a standard form to report each incident requiring the use of auto-injectable epinephrine at a public school.
